result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Avonte D Brown

records.addlTxt:
9:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Avonte D Brown in court.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Avonte D Brown. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. The State advises the Court that they are still waiting on the restitution amount from the victim and would be requesting an adjournment to get the information to the defense. Attorney Gardner agrees and states they are requesting a date in 2 rotations. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

231PM - 238PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.   Clerk PU Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found. Bound over to Branch 3. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am..   Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Avonte D Brown, appeared.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Susan G.  *Not To Discuss Case w/Justice B.

02:18 PM   Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Clerk: P. Trossen.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am. $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
